revised_title: Muscular Contractions Evoked by Excitation of the Motor Tract
tldr: The authors investigate the character of muscular contractions resulting from the excitation of different parts of the motor tract, specifically the cerebral cortex, corona radiata, and medulla spinalis. They find that the rhythm of muscular response remains constant and independent of the excitation rate, approximately ten per second. This research provides insights into the normal rate of discharge of nervous impulses and the process of summation within nerve cells.
